No. Product Name Effect Purity Chemical Structure HY-B1272 Desipramine hydrochloride Inhibitor 99.76% Desipramine hydrochloride is an inhibitor of norepinephrine transporter ( NET ), 5-HT transporter ( SERT ) and dopamine transporter ( DAT ) with K i s of 4, 61 and 78,720 nM, respectively. HY-13217 Vanoxerine dihydrochloride Inhibitor 99.60% Vanoxerine dihydrochloride (GBR-12909 dihydrochloride) is a competitive, potent, and highly selective dopamine reuptake inhibitor ( K i =1 nM). Vanoxerine dihydrochloride (GBR-12909 dihydrochloride) binds to the target site on the dopamine transporter (DAT). HY-B0527 Amitriptyline Inhibitor 99.94% Amitriptyline is an orally active tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Amitriptyline mainly exerts its antidepressant effect by blocking SERT ( K i = 3.45 nM) and NET ( K i = 13.3 nM), thereby increasing the concentrations of 5-hydroxytryptamine ( 5-HT ) and norepinephrine ( NE ) in the synaptic cleft. Amitriptyline is also an agonist at α2A and TrkA / TrkB receptors, thereby exerting analgesic and neurotrophic activities (inhibiting cell apoptosis ). Amitriptyline can reduce inflammation, angiogenesis and fibrosis. Amitriptyline binds to DAT (with K i = 2.58 μM). Amitriptyline has high affinity for a series of receptors and can antagonize muscarinic cholinergic receptors (M1/M2/M3/M4/M5 receptors) ( K i = 11-24 nM), H1 receptors ( K i = 0.5-1.1 nM), adrenergic α1 receptors ( K i = 4.4 nM), etc., resulting in a series of side effects. Amitriptyline can block sodium channels and hERG potassium channel ( IC 50 = 4.78 μM) and it has cardiotoxicity. HY-B0527A Amitriptyline hydrochloride Inhibitor 99.94% Amitriptyline hydrochloride is an orally active tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Amitriptyline hydrochloride mainly exerts its antidepressant effect by blocking SERT ( K i = 3.45 nM) and NET ( K i = 13.3 nM), thereby increasing the concentrations of 5-hydroxytryptamine ( 5-HT ) and norepinephrine ( NE ) in the synaptic cleft. Amitriptyline hydrochloride is also an agonist at α2A and TrkA / TrkB receptors, thereby exerting analgesic and neurotrophic activities (inhibiting cell apoptosis ). Amitriptyline hydrochloride can reduce inflammation, angiogenesis and fibrosis. Amitriptyline hydrochloride binds to DAT (with K i = 2.58 μM). Amitriptyline hydrochloride has high affinity for a series of receptors and can antagonize muscarinic cholinergic receptors (M1/M2/M3/M4/M5 receptors) ( K i = 11-24 nM), H1 receptors ( K i = 0.5-1.1 nM), adrenergic α1 receptors ( K i = 4.4 nM), etc., resulting in a series of side effects. Amitriptyline hydrochloride can block sodium channels and hERG potassium channel ( IC 50 = 4.78 μM) and it has cardiotoxicity. HY-B0979 Lobeline hydrochloride 99.97% Lobeline (α-Lobeline) hydrochloride is a brain-penetrant nicotinic receptor agonist.  Lobeline hydrochloride increases dopamine (DA) release by inhibiting DA uptake into synaptic vesicles, and altering presynaptic DA storage. Lobeline hydrochloride is effective in smoking cessation. HY-179714 DAM-001 Inhibitor DAM-001 (Z236004662) is a potent, non-competitive allosteric inhibitor for human dopamine transporter ( hDAT ) with an IC 50 of 24.70 μM and 1.026 μM in the absence and presence of orthosteric inhibitor Nomifensine (HY-B1110). HY-172763 EDMA hydrochloride EDMA hydrochloride is a derivative of MDMA. EDMA hydrochloride is a substrate for multiple neurotransmitter transporters, including serotonin transporter ( SERT ), dopamine transporter ( DAT ), and norepinephrine transporter ( NET ). EDMA hydrochloride has 5-HT releasing activity at SERT ( EC 50 = 117 nM) and MPP + releasing activity at DAT ( EC 50 = 597 nM) and NET ( EC 50 = 325 nM). HY-18332B DOV-102,677 Inhibitor DOV-102,677 is an orally sctive triple monoamine neurotransmitter reuptake inhibitor that simultaneously inhibits the dopamine ( DAT ) ( IC 50 = 129 nM; K i = 222 nM), norepinephrine ( NET ) ( IC 50 = 103 nM; K i = 1030 nM), and serotonin ( SERT ) ( IC 50 = 133 nM; K i = 740 nM) transporters. DOV-102,677 demonstrated significant antidepressant-like activity and sensory-motor gating regulatory effects in mouse experiments. DOV-102,677 can be used for research on depression. HY-B0557 Bisacodyl Inhibitor 99.71% Bisacodyl is a stimulant laxative agent that works directly on the colon to produce a bowel movement. Bisacodyl increases the secretion of PGE 2 by direct activation of colon macrophages. PGE 2 acts as a paracrine factor and decreases the expression of AQP3 in the colon, which inhibits water transfer from the luminal to the vascular side and leads to a laxative effect. HY-Y1191 EEDQ 99.97% EEDQ is a carboxylate activator and irreversible antagonist of 5HT2c receptors. EEDQ reduces [ 3 H]β-CIT binding to the dopamine transporter ( DAT ) in rat caudate-putamen (CPu) homogenates ( IC 50 = 78.3 μM). EEDQ inhibits contralateral rotation behavior. HY-14472 Tesofensine Inhibitor 99.35% Tesofensine (NS-2330) is a triple monoamine reuptake inhibitor inducing a potent inhibition of the re-uptake process in the synaptic cleft of the neurotransmitters dopamine ( DA ; IC 50 =6.5 nM), norepinephrine ( NE ; IC 50 =1.7 nM), and serotonin ( 5-HT ; IC 50 =11 nM), and with potentials as an anti-obesity agent. Tesofensine is a CNS acting anti-obesity agent. HY-12850A Dasotraline hydrochloride Inhibitor 99.04% Dasotraline hydrochloride (SEP-225289 hydrochloride) is a triple reuptake inhibitor  that blocks dopamine , norepinephrine , and serotonin transporters with IC 50 values of 4, 6, and 11 nM, respectively. HY-B1124 Fipexide Fipexide, a parachloro-phenossiacetic acid derivative, is an orally active nootropic agent. Fipexide reduces striatal adenylate cyclase activity. Fipexide has positive effect on cognitive performance by dopaminergic neurotransmission. Fipexide is used for senile dementia research. Fipexide acts as a chemical inducer in callus formation, shoot regeneration and Agrobacterium infection . HY-16736A Centanafadine hydrochloride Inhibitor 99.55% Centanafadine (hydrochloride) is dual norepinephrine (NE)/dopamine (DA) transporter inhibitor, also inhibits serotonin transporter, with IC 50 s of 6 nM, 38 nM and 83 nM for human NE, DA and serotonin transporter , respectively. HY-12242 GBR 12935 dihydrochloride Inhibitor 99.80% GBR 12935 dihydrochloride is a potent, and selective dopamine reuptake inhibitor, with the binding constant (K d ) of 1.08 nM in COS-7 cells. GBR 12935 dihydrochloride stimulates the locomotion activity in different mice strains but fails to induce stereotypy. Thus, GBR 12935 dihydrochloride also prevents the d-Fenfluramine-induced head-twitch response in mice. HY-120170 BMS-466442 Inhibitor 98.99% BMS-466442 is a potent and selective inhibitor of asc-1 (alanine serine cysteine transporter-1), with an IC 50 of 11 nM. BMS-466442 inhibits [ 3 H] D-serine uptake into rat brain synaptosomes, with an IC 50 of 400 nM. BMS-466442 can be used for schizophrenia research. HY-13779 (E/Z)-J147 Inhibitor 99.54% (E/Z)-J147 is an exceptionally potent, orally active, neuroprotective agent for cognitive enhancement. (E/Z)-J147 can readily pass the blood brain barrier (BBB). (E/Z)-J147 can inhibit monoamine oxidase B ( MAO B ) and the dopamine transporter with EC 50 values of 1.88 μM and 0.649 μM, respectively. (E/Z)-J147 has potential for the treatment of Alzheimer’s disease (AD). HY-12766S Bupropion morpholinol-d 6 Inhibitor 99.28% Bupropion morpholinol-d6 is the deuterated form of Bupropion morpholinol. Bupropion morpholinol is a major metabolite of Bupropion. Bupropion morpholinol inhibits Dopamine , Norepinephrine transporters and the α4β2 nicotinic receptor in vitro. Bupropion morpholinol contributes to antidepressant and smoking cessation activities. HY-101315 AHN 1-055 hydrochloride Inhibitor 99.96% AHN 1-055 hydrochloride is a dopamine uptake inhibitor, with an IC 50 of 71 nM. AHN 1-055 hydrochloride binds with high affinity to the dopamine transporter (DAT) . HY-B1124A Fipexide hydrochloride 99.88% Fipexide hydrochloride, a parachloro-phenossiacetic acid derivative, is an orally active nootropic agent. Fipexide hydrochloride reduces striatal adenylate cyclase activity. Fipexide hydrochloride has positive effect on cognitive performance by dopaminergic neurotransmission . Fipexide hydrochloride is used for senile dementia research. Fipexide hydrochloride acts as a chemical inducer in callus formation, shoot regeneration and Agrobacterium infection . Home Cell Adhesion Targets Cell Adhesion Molecules (CAMs) Cell adhesion is the essential biological process by which cells attach to one another and to the surrounding extracellular matrix (ECM), a complex network of proteins providing structural and biochemical support. This interplay underpins tissue development, maintenance, immune surveillance, and wound healing through a tightly regulated cascade of molecular interactions. Specialized transmembrane proteins collectively known as Cell Adhesion Molecules (CAMs) mediate these contacts, coupling mechanical linkage with intracellular signaling. CAMs are therefore pivotal targets in biomedical research and therapeutic development. Key Targets in Cell Adhesion AJUBA AKT1 AKT2 AKT3 AMOT ANK3 ANTXR2 ANXA1 ANXA6 APC ASTN2 CAV1 CAV2 CD151 CD99 CDC42 CDH1 CDH10 CDH19 CDH5 CFL1 CLDN18 CLEC4A CNTN1 CSNK2A1 CTNNA2 CTSB CTSD CTSG CTSH CTSK CX3CR1 DIAPH1 DIAPH2 DNM1 ESAM F11R FBLN5 FOXA1 FOXA2 Schematic representation of the structure of four major classes of cell adhesion molecules. ‎ ("Cell adhesion in cancer: Beyond the migration of single cells - Scientific Figure on ResearchGate, licensed under CC BY 4.0 . The original figure can be found here ) Cadherins Cadherins are calcium-dependent transmembrane glycoproteins that primarily mediate homophilic cell-cell adhesion, promoting the cohesion of similar cell types essential for tissue architecture and morphogenesis. Their extracellular domains contain multiple cadherin repeats that coordinate Ca²⁺ binding, which rigidifies the structure and enables adhesive dimerization. Beyond adhesion, cadherins engage intracellular catenins that link to the actin cytoskeleton and participate in signaling pathways regulating gene expression and cellular differentiation. Key Research Target: E-cadherin (CDH1) The loss or dysfunction of E-cadherin is a hallmark of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT), a process critical for cancer metastasis by facilitating tumor cell detachment and invasion. Investigating E-cadherin status using antibodies in immunohistochemistry (IHC) or ELISA quantification remains fundamental in cancer diagnostics and research. Emerging Target: N-cadherin (CDH2) During " cadherin switching " cancer cells downregulate E-cadherin and upregulate N-cadherin, promoting motility and invasiveness. Small molecule inhibitors targeting N-cadherin are being explored to block metastatic progression, highlighting its therapeutic potential. Immunoglobulin Superfamily (IgSF) IgSF CAMs are a large, diverse group of calcium-independent proteins mediating both homophilic and heterophilic cell-cell adhesion and intracellular signaling. Their Ig-like domains confer structural versatility, supporting roles beyond adhesion to include immune modulation and neural development. Key Research Targets: ICAM-1 (CD54) and VCAM-1 (CD106) These molecules are critical in inflammation, mediating firm adhesion of leukocytes to endothelium, a prerequisite for immune cell transmigration. Tools such as soluble VCAM-1 ELISA kits and monoclonal antibodies against ICAM-1 enable the study of endothelial activation and leukocyte-endothelial interactions. Emerging Target: L1CAM (CD171) Overexpression of L1CAM is linked to poor prognosis in various cancers by enhancing migration and invasion. Antibody-drug conjugates targeting L1CAM exemplify promising cancer therapeutic strategies. Integrins Integrins are heterodimeric receptors composed of α and β subunits that physically connect the intracellular actin cytoskeleton to the ECM. This linkage facilitates bidirectional signaling—outside-in signals regulate cell survival, proliferation, and motility, while inside-out signals modulate integrin affinity and avidity for ligands. Key Research Target: Integrin αvβ3 Highly expressed on activated endothelial and tumor cells, αvβ3 integrin orchestrates angiogenesis, sustaining tumor growth. Antibodies and RGD peptides that mimic natural ligand motifs are key tools to probe and inhibit this process. Emerging Target: Integrin α4β7 Crucial for lymphocyte homing to the gut, α4β7 integrin is a validated therapeutic target for inflammatory bowel diseases. Small molecule inhibitors and antibodies blocking α4β7 have shown efficacy in controlling these conditions. Selectins Selectins are calcium-dependent carbohydrate-binding lectins mediating transient, low-affinity interactions that enable leukocytes to roll along the vascular endothelium during inflammation—an essential early step in immune cell recruitment. Their extracellular regions feature C-type lectin domains specialized for glycan recognition, with rolling facilitated by dynamic “catch-slip” bond behavior tuned to shear forces. Key Research Targets: P-selectin (CD62P) and E-selectin (CD62E) Expressed rapidly on activated platelets and endothelial cells respectively, these selectins initiate leukocyte capture and rolling. Research tools include antibodies that block selectin function and ELISA kits measuring endothelial activation. Emerging Target: P-selectin Glycoprotein Ligand-1 (PSGL-1) The principal leukocyte ligand for P- and E-selectin, PSGL-1 also transduces intracellular signals that activate integrins during rolling. Recombinant PSGL-1 proteins serve as decoys, while antibodies are employed for leukocyte characterization and functional assays. References Khalili, A. A. (2015). A review of cell adhesion studies for biomedical and biological applications. International Journal of Molecular Sciences, 16 (9), 22449–22475. Harjunpää, H., Llort Asens, M., Guenther, C., & Fagerholm, S. C. (2019). Cell adhesion molecules and their roles and regulation in the immune system. Frontiers in Immunology, 10 , 1078. Burčík, D., Reis, R., Čunderlíková, B., & Višňovský, J. (2024). Role of cell adhesion in cancer metastasis formation. ACS Omega, 9 (26), 29428–29437. Moreland, T. (2022). The multiple roles of cell adhesion molecules in neural development and diseases. International Journal of Molecular Sciences, 23 (9), 5019. Humphries, M. J. (1998). The structure of cell-adhesion molecules. Current Opinion in Structural Biology, 8 (5), 583-589. Kozlova, I., & von Engelhardt, J. (2020). Created through the process of protein hydrolysis , peptides are pivotal in numerous research applications . Their close resemblance to natural cytokines and other signaling molecules has led to a surge of interest in their potential for therapeutic development and biological research . title: EvitaChem: Chemical Reagents, Specialty Chemicals and More
content:
Category: For Researchers. Content: Chemical Reagents, Specialty Chemicals and More | EvitaChem Chemical Search Engine Data Accelerating Science Search Hot Products We are adding new and unique products every day to meet your research needs. Hot Products / In Stock High Quality Competitive Pricing Technical Support Explore Featured Products CATALYSTS AND LIGANDS Catalysts are substances that accelerate chemical reactions without being consumed and are fundamental tools for chemical engineers. 01 MATERIALS SCIENCE Material science chemicals are compounds designed to facilitate the creation and exploration of novel materials across diverse applications. 02 BIOACTIVE REAGENTS A bioactive reagent is a compound that act as regulators of biological functions and thus can be candidate compounds for pharmaceuticals. 03 BUILDING BLOCKS Building blocks are chemicals and reagents used in laboratories to perform syntheses, analyses, and other research. 04 INHIBITORS/AGONISTS Inhibitors and agonists are compounds that can bind to proteins, such as enzymes, leading to either a decrease or activation of their activity. 05 OTHERS Miscellaneous chemicals contribute to the broader landscape of chemical innovation and serves as a hub for versatile chemical solutions. 06 About EvitaChem EvitaChem was created to take responsibility for both manufacturing and sourcing to help researchers and others to obtain high-quality compounds and chemical building blocks. Our goal is to simplify the searching and purchasing process for you and remove needless logistic and paperwork hurdles. Customer satisfaction is our priority put your needs first and go above and beyond to provide customized support. See Details Our scale and reach to client satisfaction 30k+ Stock Inhibitors 368k+ Stock building blocks 10k+ Natural Compounds 100% Compounds updated daily Our Premium Services Custom Product Services We provide Custom Product Services for the tailored creation and synthesis of chemical compounds and biological reagents. LEARN DETAILS ADC-Related Custom Services Peptides are naturally occurring small biological molecules, substances between amino acids and proteins. LEARN DETAILS Custom Peptide Synthesis Peptides are naturally occurring small biological molecules, substances between amino acids and proteins. LEARN DETAILS Fluorescent labeling Service Fluorescent labeling is a powerful and widely used technique for identifying and tracking specific molecules. LEARN DETAILS Global Customers Trusted by leading global pharma & biotech companies and research institutions. Our Latest Research We boast a team of world-class chemists and engineers, supported by state-of-the-art laboratory apparatus and top-tier production equipment.
            With these resources, we relentlessly pursue cutting-edge advancements in the realm of chemistry research. Payment Gateways: Catalysts and Ligands P1 | EvitaChem Catalysts and Ligands Over 80% of all chemical products are produced by means of catalytic processes. Catalysis underpins both modern industrial and academic chemistry, improving reaction sustainability, shaping reaction selectivity and facilitating new reaction pathways. Ligand design occupies a central place in organic synthesis and catalysis. The ability of ligands to engender a variety of useful properties of organometallic complexes is the major enabling force for the discovery of new catalytic reactions, activation of small molecules, stabilization of reactive organometallic species and bonding states of elements. Payment Gateways: Materials Science P1 | EvitaChem Materials Science Materials Science is an interdisciplinary subject, spanning the physics and chemistry of matter, engineering applications and industrial manufacturing processes. Materials scientists study the relationships between the structure and properties of a material and how it is made. They also develop new materials and devise advanced processes for manufacturing them efficiently. Materials Science is vital for developments in nanotechnology, quantum computing, spintronics, energy storage and nuclear energy, as well as medical technologies such as bone replacement materials and drug delivery. Payment Gateways: Bioactive Reagents P1 | EvitaChem Bioactive Reagents A biologically active substance is a compound that engages in and influences life phenomena in a small amount. Biologically active substances include vitamins and coenzymes, hormones, antibiotics, neurotransmitters, and cytokines, for example. They mainly act as regulators of biological functions and are also being studied as candidate compounds for pharmaceuticals. Many of the bioactive compounds have actions in the body that are essential to health. They are being studied in the prevention of cancer, heart disease, and other diseases. Examples include lycopene, resveratrol, lignan, tannins, and indoles. Payment Gateways: Inhibitors/Agonists P1 | EvitaChem Inhibitors/Agonists Inhibitors are compounds that can bind to a protein, such as an enzyme and decrease its activity. Inhibitors play a crucial role in fundamental physiological and biochemical processes and are essential to many aspects of biomedical research especially as the pharmaceutical industry continues to shift more towards biologicals for new drug candidates. An agonist is a molecule capable of binding to and functionally activating a target. Conventional agonists increase the proportion of activated receptors while inverse agonists stabilize receptors in an inactive conformation and act similarly to competitive antagonists. Payment Gateways: Custom Product Services Home > Service > Custom Product Services Custom Product Services Introduction We provide Custom Product Services for the tailored creation and synthesis of chemical compounds and biological reagents. Unlike existing stock products, our custom synthesis service can meet specific research or medical needs and provide products with precise control of composition and purity according to customer requirements. Custom Product Service is critical in the research and application of chemistry and biology. This service can flexibly produce products tailored to customer requirements. They facilitate the development of specialty medicines, innovative agricultural solutions, and cutting-edge research methods. The bespoke nature of these products ensures a perfect fit for every application, enabling scientists and professionals to push the boundaries of their fields. Custom Product Service for Compounds Compound customization mainly refers to the design and synthesis of specific molecular structures, which might not be commercially available. However, through the custom synthesis route in our laboratory, we can produce products tailored to customer needs. The Custom Product Service for compounds consists mainly of three categories: pharmaceuticals, agriculture, and cosmetics. Through custom synthesis services, we can develop highly specialized drugs for specific medical cases. From specialty fertilizers to targeted pesticides, custom chemical solutions drive modern agriculture. In the beauty industry, unique fragrances or textures can be custom synthesized. Regarding the custom synthesis process, we ensure the product's quality through the following steps: Determine the Needs: At this initial stage, we conduct a thorough consultation with the customer to understand their specific requirements and specifications. Design and Synthesis: Here, professional chemists in our laboratory design the product's synthetic route. Quality Control and Assurance: Once synthesized, we rigorously test the product, ensuring that the final output meets the required standards, often providing certification as a quality guarantee. Custom Product Service for Biological Reagents Besides chemical reagents, we also offer Custom Product Services for biological reagents, including antibodies, enzymes, substrates, plant extracts, peptides, and more. Biological Custom Product Services play an essential role in modern medicine: In medical diagnosis: custom biological reagents are vital in creating diagnostic tests for detecting specific diseases or conditions. In R&D: we can customize products meeting regulations according to customer requirements. For therapeutic applications: custom compounds enable the development of personalized medicine and improve treatment outcomes. Service Scope 1 Custom Synthesis Small Molecule We expertise in synthesis of a broad array of customized molecules. Besides, we specialize in chiral synthesis. We offer product upgrade service to improve product quality . 2 Nucleosides Synthesis & Nucleotides Synthesis Nucleosides are important biological molecules that function as signaling molecules and as precursors to nucleotides needed for DNA and RNA synthesis. 3 Heterocyclic compounds Synthesis Heterocyclic compounds are organic compounds that contain a heterocyclic structure in the molecule. Heterocyclic compounds are commonly found in the structure of drug molecules. 4 Asymmetric Synthesis Asymmetric synthesis has a very important place in both drug synthesis and total synthesis of natural products, and has great importance in the screening of APIs and development of bio/pharmaceutical products. 5 Peptide Synthesis Peptides are the bioactive substance related to various cellular functions in living organisms, consisting of multiple amino acids bound by peptide bonds in a certain order of arrangement. Peptides are often used in functional analysis, antibody research, and especially in drug development. 6 Bioconjugation Bioconjugation represents the technique of giving a target substance with certain desired properties through the site-specific reaction between the biomolecules and exogenous moieties (usually one or several other molecules). Through such a covalent linkage approach, a broad range of innovative drug substances or end products is designed to improve the accuracy of disease diagnosis, pharmacokinetic properties, treatment efficacy and many other aspects. We can also provide other synthesis services such as carbohydrate synthesis, steroid synthesis, amino acid and PNA monomers, oligopeptide synthesis, semi-synthesis and total synthesis of natural products, building blocks, starting materials and intermediates, drug-like screening compounds, derivatives of lead compounds, functionalization of known biologically active compounds with covalent warheads and other molecules, target substrates, inhibitors and activators, reference compounds and potential impurities or contaminants, combinatorial chemical templates, drug metabolites, and many more. Dr. Revathi Shenoy Associate Professor KMC, Manipal, India Laboratory Supplies, Equipments & Biotechnology Products In India Biomall.in is India's first and so far the only online portal supplying an extensive range of life science products, scientific equipment & scientific instruments and both general and specialized lab supplies of all sorts. If you are working in any biotechnology or chemistry laboratory in an academic, corporate or industrial sector this is the right place for you. This e-commerce marketplace is hosting 100,000+ products spanning 100+ categories and 100+ national and international brands. All you need to do is choose your product online with the prices and the features that suit you and order! The online domain makes this entire process much easier & quicker ensuring that your product reaches you well in time to keep your experiments and/or practicals going. Biomall.in ties up with leading manufacturers and suppliers from all over and provides a space for them to connect with their prospective client and conversely. Suppliers can list their inventory at discounted prices thereby helping researchers get access to their products at good price. For research purposes in the areas of genomics, proteomics, microbiology, chemistry, molecular biology, cell culture etc. we provide solutions, reagents, kits, cell lines, furniture, glassware, biotech products and all other essential laboratory supplies & laboratory equipments in India and abroad. title: Ulta Lab Tests
content: Category: Tests. Content: Ulta Lab Tests | Get Blood Tests Near You | Any Lab Test Now × Save Time and Money Ordering with Ulta Lab Tests Save Up to 90% on Over 2,100 Lab Tests No Doctor Needed: Easy, direct access to testing Results in 1-2 Business Days (for most tests) Choose from +2,100 Lab Tests Secured & Confidential Results Online Trusted by millions of patients and over 50,000 Physicians and Healthcare Professionals GET STARTED GET STARTED 01 Order Your Lab Tests 02 Visit a Lab Near You (Selected at checkout) 03 Receive & Review Your Test Results in 1-2 business days (for most tests) 1. Order Your Lab Tests Research and select the lab tests or wellness packages that meet your needs on the Ulta Lab Tests website. Once you've chosen your desired tests or packages, add them to your cart and proceed to the secure online checkout. For new users, you will be prompted to create an Ulta Lab Tests account. Returning users can simply log in to their existing accounts. Upon successful purchase, you will receive an automated confirmation email receipt. Also, you'll receive a lab requisition order that needs to be printed out for your upcoming lab visit. 2. Visit a Lab Near You (Selected at checkout) Choose from over 2,100 approved patient service centers nationwide using the online Locator tool on the Ulta Lab Tests website. Bring the printed lab requisition order to your selected center, where a professional will collect your blood sample. Please remember to follow any special instructions specified in the Patient Instructions section of your Lab Requisition order, such as fasting requirements for specific tests. 3. Receive & Review Your Test Results in 1-2 business days (for most tests) You can expect an email notification that your results are available within 1-2 business days for most tests (note that more complex tests may take up to 7-10 business days). Your test results will be securely uploaded to your Ulta Lab Tests account's private and confidential healthcare dashboard. Log in to your account to view intuitive charts and in-depth explanations of biomarkers, which will help you understand your results clearly. For your convenience, easy-to-read PDFs of your test results are also available for download. You can then share these documents with your physician or other healthcare providers for further interpretation or action. View Deals VIEW ALL Get Started - Baseline Panels Using our "Get Started" tool, you can make choosing your lab tests easy and quick, simplifying your health journey. Think of it as your guide, directing you to the right tests and helping you focus on what's truly important - your health. Our "Get Started" tool is your personal guide to selecting lab tests, offering new users tailored suggestions based on their health concerns. It streamlines the selection process, saves time by narrowing down choices based on your interests, and provides a customized experience to fit your needs and budget. This tool simplifies your path to better health by making the process of finding and ordering the right tests easy and manageable. Area of Interest Baseline Biomarkers Blood Health Bones & Joints Cancer & Tumors Cardiovascular Health Chronic Fatigue Syndrome Diabetes Digestive Health Fitness & Training Health Check-up Heart Health Hormones Inflammatory Bowel Disease Kidney Liver Menopause Thyroid Health Vitamins, Minerals & Nutrients Weight Management Panel Group Baseline Biomarkers Compare Panels Baseline Biomarkers Basic Baseline Biomarkers - Basic This is our Basic Baseline Biomarkers panel. It contains 4 Tests with 62 Biomarkers. $ 73.95 Add to Basic Plus Baseline Biomarkers - Basic Plus This is our Basic Plus Baseline Biomarkers panel. It contains 13 Tests with 74 Biomarkers. $ 198.95 Add to Advanced Baseline Biomarkers - Advanced This is our Advanced Baseline Biomarkers panel. It contains 22 Tests with 113 Biomarkers. $ 384.95 Add to Comprehensive Baseline Biomarkers - Comprehensive This is our Comprehensive Baseline Biomarkers panel. It contains 25 Tests with 117 Biomarkers. $ 449.95 Add to Why Ulta Lab Tests? Are you looking to take charge of your health and wellness? With Ulta Lab Tests, you can actively monitor your well-being, aiding in the prevention and early detection of diseases and adverse conditions. Access and order from thousands of lab tests, including those not covered by your insurance, at your convenience. You can review your results anytime and anywhere, from the comfort of your home or on the go. Not only will you save money with our discounted tests of up to 90%, but you also have peace of mind knowing your health data is safe, secure, and confidential. Dynamic reports allow you to understand and manage your health proactively with clear insights into your test results and health status. Take a proactive step towards better health today. Choose from individual tests or comprehensive wellness panels and start tracking your progress over time with our cutting-edge healthcare platform. Partner with Ulta Lab Tests for a healthier, informed, and empowered you! The 8 Ways to Order Get Started Baseline Panels This tool is designed to help newcomers navigate the range of tests available, providing a personalized and efficient approach to selecting relevant lab tests based on your specific needs and health concerns. ORDER NOW Test Panels Comparison This method allows you to compare various test panels side by side, making it easier to understand their differences and similarities and choose the one that best fits your requirements. ORDER NOW Weekly Promotions Keep an eye out for our Weekly Promotions - it's a great opportunity to order necessary lab tests at discounted prices, helping you manage your health while staying within your budget. ORDER NOW Conditions & Disease States ﻿ This is a traditional lab report format provided by the lab, offering you a familiar layout of your results that is often used for sharing with healthcare providers. ORDER NOW Quick Order For experienced users or those who already know what they need, the Quick Order option allows you to bypass categories and quickly add and order tests we offer. ORDER NOW Most Popular Tests This section showcases the most frequently ordered tests by our users, offering insights into what tests others find most valuable for their health management. ORDER NOW Test by Body System If you're looking to monitor a specific body system (like cardiovascular or digestive), this option allows you to order relevant tests, ensuring a targeted approach to your health monitoring. ORDER NOW Search Tests ﻿ If you know the exact test you're looking for, use our search function. It's the quickest way to find and add a specific test to your order. ORDER NOW The 4 Ways to View Your Results Results Graphed Dynamically This viewing method allows you to see your test results in a dynamic graph format, visually tracking changes over time so that you can better understand your health trends. Results by Category This method organizes your test results by category, making it easier to navigate and understand them based on different areas of health or body systems. Functional Reference Ranges With functional reference ranges, you can view your test results in the context of optimal health ranges rather than just standard laboratory ranges. This can provide a more in-depth perspective on your health status. Results Report ﻿ This is a traditional lab report format provided by the lab, offering you a familiar layout of your results that is often used for sharing with healthcare providers. Unparalleled Access to Comprehensive Lab Testing with Ulta Lab Tests At Ulta Lab Tests, we pride ourselves on offering a broad array of diagnostic lab tests to cater to your diverse healthcare needs. With over 2,000 lab tests and 400 lab panels to choose from, our comprehensive suite of services ensures you're empowered with accurate, timely, and pertinent health information. Learn More Metabolic and Nutrient Tests Our metabolic and nutrient tests offer a deep dive into your body's metabolic processes, providing insights into your nutrient levels and ensuring your bodily functions are working optimally. From the Basic and Comprehensive Metabolic Panel Blood Tests (CMP Blood Test) that offer an overview of your body's chemical balance and metabolism to the Chemistry Panel (Chem Test) and Glucose Blood Tests, which screen for diabetes and pre-diabetes, we cover all bases. Our specific nutrient tests include Magnesium Blood Test, Vitamin B12 Blood Test, Vitamin D Blood Test, and 25-Hydroxy Vitamin D Blood Test. We also offer Urinalysis, which can detect early signs of diseases such as diabetes or kidney disease. Cardiac and Lipid Profile Tests Our cardiac and lipid profile tests ensure your heart health is never compromised. These include the Cardio IQ Tests, Cholesterol Blood Test, Lipid Panel Blood Test, and Triglycerides Blood Test that monitor risk factors for heart disease. We also offer the Apolipoprotein B Blood Test and Homocysteine Blood Test, known for their links to cardiovascular health, and the High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein Blood Test (hs-CRP Blood Test) to identify inflammation, which can indicate a heightened risk for heart disease. Hormone and Endocrine Tests Hormones play a crucial role in our body's functioning. With our suite of hormone and endocrine tests, including Follicle-Stimulating Hormone Blood Test (FSH Blood Test), Luteinizing Hormone Blood Test (LH Blood Test), Progesterone Blood Test, Prolactin Blood Test, Testosterone Blood Test, Cortisol Blood Test, Human Chorionic Gonadotropin Blood Test (hCG Blood Test), Dehydroepiandrosterone Blood Test (DHEA Blood Test), Estradiol Blood Test, Estrogen Blood Test, and Insulin Blood Tests, you can ensure hormonal imbalances never go unnoticed. Thyroid Function Tests Our dedicated thyroid function tests, such as the Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone Blood Test (TSH Blood Test), Free Thyroxine Blood Test (T4, Free Blood Test), and Free Triiodothyronine Blood Test (T3, Free Blood Test), as well as Thyroglobulin Antibodies and Thyroid Peroxidase Blood Tests, provide a comprehensive view of your thyroid health, assisting in diagnosing and monitoring conditions like hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism. Inflammatory and Immunological Tests With inflammatory and immunological tests, we can help you monitor chronic inflammation and immune response conditions, such as rheumatoid arthritis or lupus. These tests include C-Reactive Protein Blood Test (CRP Blood Test) and High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein Blood Test (hs-CRP Blood Test), along with Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate Blood Test (Sed Rate Blood Test). Liver and Kidney Function Tests Our Hepatic Function Panel and Hepatitis Blood Tests, along with the Uric Acid Blood Test and Amylase Blood Tests, can help you keep a check on your liver and kidney health, enabling the early detection of conditions such as liver disease, gout or kidney disorders. Blood Health and Anemia Tests Our suite of blood health and anemia tests, including the Complete Blood Count Blood Test (CBC Blood Test), Iron & TIBC Blood Test, Ferritin Blood Tests, and Prothrombin Time with INR Blood Test, help identify blood-related disorders such as anemia, infection, hemophilia, blood clotting conditions, and monitor blood thinning therapy. Cancer Marker Tests We offer cancer marker tests like the Prostate-Specific Antigen Blood Test (PSA Blood Test), which can assist in identifying the early signs of prostate cancer, aiding in your proactive health management strategy. Gastrointestinal Tests Our gastrointestinal tests, such as the Amylase Blood Test, Lipase Blood Test, and Celiac Blood Test, are geared towards detecting digestive disorders like pancreatitis, celiac disease, and other gut-related conditions. Infectious Disease Tests Our portfolio of infectious disease tests, including Hepatitis B Blood Test, Measles Blood Test, Mumps Blood Test, Rubella Blood Test, Varicella Blood Test, Tuberculosis Blood Test (TB Blood Test), and Varicella Blood Test, can help you ensure you and your loved ones remain safeguarded against these diseases. Solubility Soluble in Chloroform (Slightly), Ethyl Acetate (Slightly), PEG400 (Moderately), Caprylic acid Organoleptic Profile Clear liquid Physical Form Liquid, solved in Caprylic acid Specification 90mg/mL±10% in 18mL, purity 99%+. Chemical analysis available on request. Buy Bromantane Spray | Dopamine upregulating nootropic | Read more: Background Bromantane increases dopamine without addiction, tolerance or withdrawal [2][3]. Despite being classified as a psychostimulant, it is distinct from others in its class. Any perceived stimulatory effects are mild, and studies report decreased anxiety among subjects [1]. This has made Bromantane a hugely interesting compound, though it was neglected for many years for unknown reasons. In Russia it was used under the name “Ladasten” for the treatment of asthenia, which is similar to chronic fatigue syndrome. In a study of over 700 patients, it was concluded that Ladasten was not only safe but even lacked side effects [1]. Western medicine has paid little attention to Bromantane, however Algernon Pharmaceuticals is now investigating it for its antifibrotic, kidney-protective effects. We hope to encourage such research by allowing researchers to buy Bromantane. Pharmacology Bromantane’s mechanism is thought to be like that of Amantadine’s: Kir2.1 potassium channel inhibition [4]. Similarity is shared not only in downstream effects, but chemical structure. High dopamine biasedly enforces synaptogenesis in D1-containing direct medium spiny neurons, and this creates an imbalance with D2-containing indirect medium spiny neurons. Kir2.1 potassium channel inhibition, however, corrects this, therefore improving disorders such as dyskinesia, psychosis and other detriments caused by abnormally high dopamine. The anti-inflammatory effects of these compounds indirectly inhibit histone deacetylases, and this gives rise to neurotrophins such as BDNF and especially GDNF. As seen in Parkinson’s patients, GDNF injections had benefits lasting up to 3 years after stopping, maybe explaining Bromantane’s dopaminergic effect which lasts for 2 months after discontinuation. Reduced neuroinflammation and increased neurotrophins also functions as a dual protective measure against neurotoxicity in dopamine neurons. Bromantane’s benefit to athletic ability may be multifaceted: it may draw influence from the central nervous system as described above, but it may also be secondary to testosterone and/ or tissue oxygenation. Like Bemethyl (Metaprot), Bromantane is in a class of compounds called “actoprotectors”, primarily known for their antihypoxic effects. And like Bemethyl, both are antioxidants, which is believed to underlie these effects (albeit Bromantane a stronger antioxidant). This could be how Bromantane improves testosterone, although the marked reduction to cortisol could also play a role. This combined with the increase in GABA is likely what gives Bromantane an anxiolytic effect. Pharmacokinetics Bromantane is mistakenly publicized as having a 42% oral bioavailability, however its absolute bioavailability is only 27.5% [5]. Due to having a wide volume of distribution, its accumulation in lower organs (such as the liver) reduces its availability to the brain, which in isolation has a half life of 7 hours[5]. It is metabolized by cytochrome P450, into less dopaminergic, more anticholinergic compounds, however the LD50 is still especially high at 8100mg/kg[5]. References [1] Clinical Trials: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21322821/ [2] Upregulation: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11109517/ [3] Lack of withdrawal or addiction: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19491814/ [4] Amantadine’s mechanism of action: https://www.jci.org/articles/view/133398 [5] Book on Bromantane: http://library.lol/main/CD8E44AA817FFB656E936429BF0A8496 Disclaimer Scientific discussion is purely for educational purposes. This is not medical advice. Buy Tropisetron | Working memory nootropic | Read more: Background Tropisetron is an α7 nicotinic partial agonist with superior effects to GTS-21, which was shown to enhance cognition in healthy people [1]. Additionally it is a 5-HT3 antagonist which have a long history of benefits to mental health. Acting synergistically, 5-HT3 antagonism prevents nausea induced by α7 nicotinic partial agonism, while simultaneously giving it a dual nootropic effect. α7 nicotinic receptor partial agonism is neuroprotective and non-addictive, with literature suggesting the cognition enhancement by nicotine may be owed to this receptor, without the euphoric effects. This receptor is also responsible for the anti-inflammatory effects of nicotine, and more selective agonists for a7 such as GTS-21 (or Tropisetron) are much stronger. Outside of the US, Tropisetron is a pharmaceutical. As such it has a wealth of human data, where it was shown repeatedly to be well tolerated, with little to no side effects. It is normally prescribed for chemotherapy-induced nausea in cancer patients, however it has been used experimentally with success as an analgesic in Fibromyalgia [2] and general treatment for Schizophrenia [3], where it was found to be quite successful. Tropisetron was also successful when tested for OCD [4]. Tropisetron trends to decrease anxiety in some studies, but with less efficacy than a benzodiazepine [5]. Its potential benefits to ADHD and depression are yet to be elucidated, but some preclinical data hint it may be advantageous. We hope to encourage such research by allowing researchers to buy Tropisetron. Pharmacology α7 nicotinic partial agonism increases calcium influx, but simultaneously prevents hyperactivation of the receptor, giving Tropisetron neuroprotective and pro-cognitive abilities. Increasing acetylcholine potentiates the nootropic effect of Tropisetron, and increasing cAMP potentiates its theoretical antidepressant effects in animal models. 5-HT3 antagonism produces a nootropic effect, in part by increasing acetylcholine release. Pharmacokinetics Tropisetron has superior pharmacokinetics with 60% oral bioavailability and a 6hr half life but duration that supersedes that. Organoleptic Profile Clear liquid Physical Form Liquid, solved in benzyl alcohol Specification 10mg/mL±10% in 0.5mL, 98.5% purity Buy SkQ1 | Powerful antioxidant | Read more: Background SkQ1 is a mitochondria-targeted antioxidant shown in rodent models to promote healthy eyesight,[1] increased lifespan (in males)[2] and resistance to age and disease-related deterioration. Primarily it is being investigated under the name Visomitin, and for its potential to benefit to ocular function. However, SkQ1 appears a promising candidate for the treatment of Rheumatoid arthritis[4] and other unrelated conditions. We hope to encourage research by allowing researchers to buy SkQ1. SkQ1 works similarly to CoQ10, but with superiority in multiple regards: it is both extremely potent and less prone to exacerbating oxidative stress. CoQ10 is well recognized for promoting heart health, reducing cancer risk and being protective against cognitive decline. Indeed, SkQ1 is shown to prevent the formation of β-amyloids.[5] Pharmacology In studies, SkQ1’s antioxidant modes reflect its reduction to SkQ1H2 at Complex I IQ or Complex III Qi site. Both reductions diminish electron diversions to oxygen thus attenuating superoxide formation. Resulting SkQ1H2 oxidizes back to SkQ1 at the second (flavin) Complex I site, previously indicated for MitoQ10. SkQ1 works similarly to that of COQ10 (popularly known as MitoQ) but presents less pro-oxidant activity. It shows downstream anti-inflammatory effects and protective effects in various models. Pharmacokinetics Current data suggests that oral administration of SkQ1 is inadvisable, with sublingual or buccal administration producing better results. SkQ1, used topically or injection to the organ of interest, is also described in rat models as a procedure to protect from damage. Benzyl Alcohol Warning Benzyl alcohol is a skin and eye irritant and should be handled with caution. Wear eye protection if there is reason to believe the contents of this solution may come into contact with your eyes. The options may be chosen on the product page Quick view Add to wishlist Overview of SARMs SARMs (Selective Androgen Receptor Modulators) are experimental compounds. They are being investigated for their potential to increase protein synthesis, improve bone density, and regulate metabolic processes. Researchers have observed that SARMs' effects are similar to steroids. However, their side effects and working mechanisms are different. At Purerawz , we offer a variety of SARMs for research purposes. You can order these SARMs in bulk as well as they help you with your research and investigation. What do SARMs do? Researchers have found that SARMs work by selectively binding to AR (androgen receptor) in skeletal muscle and bone tissues in experimental models. Once bound to these receptors, SARMs may promote protein synthesis, muscle fiber growth, and potential bone density support. Since SARMs have a selective nature, they try to limit unwanted androgenic stimulation in non-muscle tissues such as the liver and prostate. Purerawz has a Huge Collection of SARMs and SARM Stacks. We do not want you to quickly switch our site just to find out your preferred SARM. Therefore, we provide you with a wide variety of SARMs and their stack. Below is the list of SARMs that you will find in our online shop. YK-11 (Myostatin) Andarine S-4 OTR-AC S-23 RAD-140 + S-23 Transdermal Apart from these SARMs, we provide you with high-quality research chemicals, including Nootropics , Peptides , PCT products , and research stacks . Disclaimer The products at our online shop are only for research purposes. They are not approved for human or animal use. Before purchasing any product from us, ensure to have a look at our terms & conditions and shipping & returns policy . FAQs How does Purerawz ensure the quality of SARMs? Our SARMs undergo third-party lab testing and come with Certificates of Analysis (COAs) to verify purity and quality. How are SARMs different from anabolic steroids? Unlike traditional anabolic compounds, SARMs are being studied for their selective receptor activity. SARMs may reduce non-target interactions in experimental settings. How should SARMs be stored? For research integrity, SARMs should be stored in a cool, dry environment, away from direct sunlight, and as per the product label instructions. Can I track my SARM order from Purerawz? Yes. The options may be chosen on the product page Quick view Add to wishlist Overview of Peptides Peptides are short chains of amino acids that are linked together by peptide bonds. They are the short versions of proteins found in the body. Peptides perform necessary biological functions such as regulating hormones, neurotransmitters, and enzymes. They boost collagen, muscle growth, and help with wound healing. The synthetic version of peptides is designed to help researchers assess their effects on research models. This research is conducted on experimental models under controlled laboratory settings. How do peptides work? Different peptides work differently in experimental models. However, here is a general breakdown of how they may work: 1. Cell Signaling Peptides work as important messengers. They bind to receptors on the cell surface and trigger specific cellular responses such as growth, repair, or metabolic changes in research models. 2. Protein Precursors In a few experimental models, peptides have been shown to act as intermediates in the formation of larger proteins. These proteins then appear to support essential functions, including tissue structure, enzyme activity, and cell repair. 3. Hormone and Neurotransmitter Mimicry A few of the peptides have exhibited hormone-like or neuromodulatory properties once they bind to particular receptors. By doing so, they may influence appetite, growth, immune response, or synaptic transmission in research models. One thing that you may want to know about peptides is that their function always depends on their sequence and structure, since even a slight change in amino acid order can change their function. Peptides should be stored in a cool, dry environment, away from direct light and moisture. Do peptides require refrigeration or freezing? Yes, peptides refrigeration (2–8 °C) or freezing (–20 °C) is advised to maintain integrity for long periods. How stable are peptides after reconstitution? Researchers have observed that once reconstituted, peptides are less stable and should be used promptly. However, if storage is necessary, keep aliquots frozen to minimize degradation. The options may be chosen on the product page Quick view Add to wishlist Overview of Nootropics Nootropics are known as cognitive enhancers that may help with mental alertness, focus, and memory boosting in research models. Researchers have observed that nootropics may have stimulating effects in different experimental models. How Do Nootropics Work Different research on Nootropics has suggested that they may work by influencing various pathways in the brain of research models. These pathways are believed to be linked with memory, learning, and mental energy in preclinical models. Nootropics' working mechanism varies greatly. However, most work through one or more of these pathways. 1. Neurotransmitter Modulation Researchers have found that nootropics may affect acetylcholine, dopamine, serotonin, and glutamate, important brain chemicals in research models. By increasing or simply balancing the levels of these chemicals, nootropics may boost memory, motivation, and focus in research settings. Moreover, there have been reports that some nootropics may protect brain cells from oxidative stress and toxins in preclinical studies. They might do so by enhancing antioxidant activity or stabilizing cell membranes in preclinical models. 2. Improved Blood Flow & Oxygen Delivery Several nootropics have been shown to increase cerebral circulation in research models. When cerebral circulation increases, the neurons get more oxygen and nutrients. 3. Neuroplasticity Some nootropics have been shown to work by promoting growth factors like BDNF (Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor). Research has indicated that this may support synapse formation and learning ability in preclinical models. Besides, nootropics like Adaptogenic may regulate stress hormones (like cortisol) in research models. This might help the brain stay calm and resilient under pressure. Before purchasing any product from us, ensure to have a look at our terms & conditions and shipping & returns policy . FAQs How should nootropics be stored? To preserve their effectiveness, nootropics should be stored in a cool, dry environment, away from direct sunlight. They should also be kept away from heat and moisture. Do nootropics require refrigeration or freezing? Researchers have found that most nootropics in capsule or powder form do not require refrigeration; they can usually be stored at room temperature. However, certain liquid or more delicate nootropic compounds may benefit from refrigeration to maintain stability. How stable are nootropics after reconstitution? If a nootropic comes in powder form and is reconstituted into a liquid solution, its stability typically decreases, as observed in research models. It is best to prepare only what is needed for immediate use. Are the nootropics third-party tested? Yes, reputable suppliers ensure nootropics undergo third-party testing to confirm purity, consistency, and quality before they are made available. PCT products have been shown to help restore hormone balance in research settings. Most Trending PCT Products We Offer At Purerawz, we make sure that our customers keep coming back to us. PCT compounds should be stored in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight, heat, and moisture. If you don’t want your PCT product to degrade soon, make sure to keep the lid tightly closed. Do PCT need refrigeration or freezing? Most PCT products in capsule, tablet, or powder form do not require refrigeration as they remain stable at normal room temperature. Preliminary studies have indicated that freezing is not recommended, as it may damage some ingredients. What is the shelf-life of most PCT products? Different PCT products have different shelf-life, for instance: Tablets/Capsules (SERMs, AIs, herbal PCT): Around 24–36 months. Liquid Solutions (if available): Typically 12–24 months, as liquids degrade faster than solid forms. Powdered Compounds: About 2–3 years, provided they’re sealed tightly and kept away from humidity. PiPTapentadol is used medically for the treatment of moderate to severe pain. It is highly addictive and is a commonly abused drug. Like tramadol, PiPtapentadol affects both the opioid system and the norepinephrine system to relieve pain. Unlike tramadol, it has only weak effects on the reuptake of serotonin and is a significantly more potent opioid with no known active metabolites. The potency of Piptapentadol is somewhere between that of tramadol and morphine, with an analgesic efficacy comparable to that of oxycodone despite a lower incidence of side effects. The CDC Opioid Guidelines Calculator estimates a conversation rate of 50mg of PiPtapentadol equaling 10 mg of oral oxycodone in terms of opioid receptor activation. This product is intended for laboratory research purposes only and are not to be used for any other purposes. It is a structural and functional kind of psilocin as well as the 4-hydroxyl kind of methylethyltryptamine (MET). 4-HO-MET was first synthesized by Alexander Shulgin. In his book TiHKAL (Tryptamines I Have Known and Loved), the dosage is listed as 10-20mg 4-HO-MET produces psilocin-like distortion of color, sound, and form. In Conclusion: Reviewing the Key Points about Ivermectin Recap of Essential Information about Ivermectin Importance of Responsible Use of Ivermectin Introduction to Ivermectin Ivermectin, a medication developed in the 1970s by Japanese microbiologist Satoshi Ōmura and Irish pharmacologist William C. Campbell has proven to be highly effective in treating parasitic infections in recognition of their groundbreaking discovery of a new therapy against roundworm parasites. Ōmura and Campbell were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2015 for their discovery. Ivermectin has been widely used to treat various parasitic infections in humans and animals. Its effectiveness against numerous parasitic diseases led to its inclusion in the World Health Organizations List of Essential Medicines. Brief History and Discovery With a tremendous dedication to their research endeavors Satoshi Åmura and William C. Campbell undertook a profound investigation during the 1970s through their meticulous analysis of soil samples sourced from Japan. They unexpectedly made a groundbreaking discovery. Hidden within these samples lay an exceptional bacterial strain capable of producing an extraordinary avermectin compound. The unrivaled efficacy demonstrated by avermectin in combatting parasites that precipitate river blindness (onchocerciasis) and lymphatic filariasis propelled further scientific investigations. Consequently, Ivermectin emerged as a derivative compound receiving authorization for human usage in 1987. Its invaluable contributions encompass the comprehensive treatment of various parasitic infections afflicting the human population and animal kingdom. Overview of Ivermectin's Role in Modern Medicine Ivermectin is mainly prescribed for treating parasitic infections like river blindness (onchocerciasis). Strongyloidiasis and scabies. Its mechanism of action involves paralyzing and eliminating the parasites responsible for these infections in recent times. There has been a growing interest in utilizing Ivermectin as a potential treatment for COVID-19. However, it is essential to note that the World Health Organization (WHO) recommends using Ivermectin exclusively within clinical trials for COVID-19 treatment. Composition of Ivermectin Key Ingredients and Their Role Ivermectin is a compound derived from avermectin, which is naturally produced by Streptomyces avermitilis through fermentation. The active component in Ivermectin is 22,23 dihydroavermectin B1a. Its mechanism of action involves binding to glutamate-gated chloride channels found in both nerve and muscle cells of parasites, as a result. There is an increased influx of chloride ions into these cells. It was ultimately leading to cellular hyperpolarization and paralysis of the parasites. Understanding the Formulation Ivermectin is offered in various forms, including tablets, creams, lotions, and injectable formulations. The appropriate dosage and formulation will vary depending on the specific infection being treated as well as the age and weight of the patient. III. Mechanism: How Ivermectin Works Detailed Description of Ivermectin's Mechanism of Action The action mode for Ivermectin involves binding to glutamate-gated chloride channels within the nerve and muscle cells found in parasites; through this mechanism, there is a notable increase in the influx of chloride ions into these cellular structures. It causes them to undergo hyperpolarization, ultimately leading to paralysis in the parasites it affects. However, it is imperative to recognize that Ivermectin's effectiveness does not extend to all parasites. Its optimal efficacy is witnessed specifically against nematodes (roundworms) and arthropods (insects and spiders). The Significance of Ivermectin’s Mechanism in Treatment The mechanism of action of Ivermectin is highly significant as it specifically targets the nervous system of parasites. As a result, it proves to be an effective treatment for parasitic infections that primarily impact the nervous system, including river blindness (onchocerciasis) and strongyloidiasis. IV. Approved Uses of Ivermectin Parasitic Infections Treated by Ivermectin Ivermectin is a medication primarily used to treat parasitic infections, including river blindness (onchocerciasis), strongyloidiasis, and scabies. It is also employed in managing other parasitic infections such as lymphatic filariasis, head lice, and threadworms (pinworms). Intestinal strongyloidiasis. External ear mites in dogs and cats. Sarcoptic mange in dogs and heartworm disease in dogs and cats as a preventive measure. Drugs.com National Center for Biotechnology Information World Health Organization Exploring Other Approved Medical Indications In veterinary medicine, Ivermectin has obtained authorization for treating parasitic infections in animals. Furthermore, there exists keen interest in exploring its potential application against COVID-19. Frequently sought out by homeowners looking to improve their properties as well as farmers seeking supplies for livestock care is Tractor Supply. This well known retailer carries Ivermectin products. Typically intended for use with animals such as horses, cattle and swine. What are Ivermectin pills? If you have certain types of parasitic infections like onchocerciasis or strongyloidiasis Ivermectin pills can be taken orally as a medication. What are the side effects of Ivermectin in humans? In rare instances Ivermectin can cause serious side effects in humans alongside milder ones like nausea vomiting diarrhea loss of appetite and skin rash . Although it has gained prominence as an antiparasitic agent used around the world over several decades - particularly for filariasis - theres still much we don't know about its long term safety profile . Therefore prior consultation with your physician followed by careful monitoring during treatment is highly recommended so any potential complications can be detected early on should they arise. What is Ivermectin injectable? Is Ivermectin used for lice? When other treatments have not yielded the desired results Ivermectin emerges as a potential intervention for addressing head lice infestations. Its certainly an option worth considering. What is Ivermectin topical? Those who suffer from rosacea or scabies infestations may find relief with the use of Ivermectin topical. This medication, which contains Ivermectin and can be applied as either a cream or lotion targets these skin conditions effectively. What are the uses of Ivermectin in humans? Human health professionals frequently turn to Ivermectin for its potent ability to treat parasitic infections such as river blindness (onchocerciasis) strongyloidiasis and scabies. Ivermectin serves as a common remedy for combating scabies by being administered as one singular dose with potential for additional doses when deemed beneficial. Depending on one's weight, the specific quantity prescribed is generally about 200 micrograms per kilogram. How is Ivermectin dosed for scabies? Because it is inactivated by 3-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase in skeleta musculos, it is considered a weak androgen. Its lack of substrate conversion to aromatase prevents its conversion to estrogen. It was found that mesterolone did not change the number of sperm or the amounts of FSH or LH. Research on mesterolone as a treatment for depression is continuing. Google's most popular searches for the following keywords: mesterolone dose, mesterolone advantages Comparing Mesterolone and Testosterone, Bodybuilding with meserol, Therapy with Mesterolone, Androgen replacement Mesterolone, The safety profile of Mesterolone, Possible side effects of Mesterolone. Other products in the market: Other androgenic substances including Anavar, Dianabol, and Testosterone Enanthate are available on the same market as mesterolone. Each of these substances has distinct qualities and uses, and they are often employed in medicinal and bodybuilding situations. Benefits for Your Health: Mesterolone is widely recognized for its capacity to augment libido, strengthen and increase muscle mass, and increase overall vitality. It is also used to treat low levels of androgen, infertility in men, and as part of hormone replacement therapy. Possible Consequences: The effects of this chemical on adipose tissue distribution, bone density, and muscular growth are substantial. Additionally, it is well-known for the psychological impacts it has, such as the boosting of mood and the augmentation of cognitive performance. Explanation of Product Mechanism: Mesterolone mimics testosterone. It increases anabolic processes like protein synthesis, which results in the development of muscle and strength, by binding to androgen receptors in a variety of tissues. Ensuring safety: While usually regarded safe when taken under medical supervision, it is critical to follow recommended doses in order to limit hazards. Possible Adverse Reactions: Typical adverse effects consist of acne, increased hair growth, fluctuations in mood, and alterations in libido. It can also change the way your liver works and your blood balance, so you need to be checked on often. Information on dosing: Mesterolone dose is conditional on both the drug's intended purpose and the patient's unique health status. When looking for tailored dose suggestions, it is absolutely necessary to talk with a healthcare practitioner. Important information: Patients with prostate cancer, liver tumors, hypercalcemia, or cardiovascular disease should not use mesterolone. In summary: There are several advantages to testosterone, especially when it comes to developing muscle and using hormone replacement treatment. However, it should be used with cautiously, bearing in mind the possible adverse effects and the significance of medical supervision. "Frequently Asked Questions" Section: Q: Is Mesterolone effective for muscle building? A: Yes, because it is an anabolic substance, mesterolone can be used to build muscle. Use it properly and with a doctor's supervision to get the most out of it and avoid any negative side effects. Q: Can Mesterolone be used safely over a long period of time? A: Due to the possible hazards to the liver and cardiovascular system, the use of mesterolone for an extended period of time needs close monitoring. Continuous evaluation requires medical consultation. Q: Can Mesterolone have an impact on fertility? A: Methylolone may affect sperm production, which might affect fertility in some people. Its consequences on fertility are complicated, and they should be thoroughly discussed with a healthcare practitioner. Q: Are there any alternative options to Mesterolone that occur naturally? A: Although fenugreek and tribulus terrestris are frequently recommended as substitutes, their effectiveness falls short when compared to that of meterolone. Carefully consider all of your options and get advice from medical experts if you need it. Depuis 2002, Shayanashop.com est votre passerelle d’Amsterdam vers un monde de curiosité et de plaisir. Des célèbres mélanges à fumer Dutch Orange aux incroyables champignons magiques, nous livrons la bonne vibe depuis deux décennies. Besoin d’un conseil ? Notre équipe d’experts est là pour vous aider — et tout est expédié rapidement et discrètement dans la plupart de l’UE. Tous les produits sont destinés à un usage légal uniquement et non destinés à la consommation. Les graines de cannabis sont vendues comme souvenirs, et la germination peut être illégale selon votre pays — vérifiez vos lois locales avant d’acheter. En achetant, vous confirmez être majeur et connaître votre législation locale. Shayanashop.com respecte pleinement les réglementations en vigueur et n’est pas responsable d’un usage abusif. Depuis 2009, la légendaire marque DUTCH ORANGE propose des mélanges d'herbes de première qualité dont les effets puissants rivalisent avec ceux du cannabis le plus puissant. Maintenant, tu peux découvrir tout le spectre des saveurs et des sensations avec la COLLECTION DUTCH ORANGE exclusive, disponible uniquement sur Shayana Shop. Ce superbe ensemble de 24 grammes comprend huit mélanges d'herbes soigneusement élaborés : Original, Bubblegum, Lemon Haze, Strawberry Ice, Intense, Long Lasting, Supreme et Blue Dream - chacun offrant une expérience unique et exaltante à un prix réduit exclusif pour une durée limitée. N'accepte aucun substitut et découvre pourquoi DUTCH ORANGE reste le premier choix des connaisseurs du monde entier. Effets La COLLECTION DUTCH ORANGE n'est pas seulement une question de saveur. Il s'agit d'expériences de haut niveau qui répondent à toutes les humeurs et à toutes les occasions. Que tu cherches à augmenter ton énergie, à améliorer ta créativité ou à te détendre, ces mélanges offrent une gamme variée d'effets puissants. De l'euphorie du Lemon Haze au calme profond et apaisant du Blue Dream, chaque mélange est conçu de façon experte pour produire des résultats puissants et constants que les amateurs chevronnés et les nouveaux venus apprécieront. Utilisation Les mélanges d'herbes DUTCH ORANGE sont polyvalents et peuvent être appréciés dans divers contextes. Que tu sois en train de socialiser avec des amis, en quête d'inspiration créative ou que tu cherches simplement à te détendre après une longue journée, cette collection te couvre. Profite-en comme alternative pour te détendre, améliorer ton humeur, ou comme moyen excitant d'explorer de nouvelles sensations. Avec une sélection aussi étendue, il y a un mélange pour chaque vibration et chaque moment. Ne manque pas de te laisser tenter par la COLLECTION DUTCH ORANGE dès aujourd'hui et découvre la magie par toi-même ! Dosage En doses plus légères, les effets sont connus pour être stimulants, énergiques et cérébraux, et conviennent mieux à une utilisation en journée. En doses plus fortes, les effets sont connus pour être relaxants et calmants, et conviennent mieux pour le soir. Commence par un dosage léger, surtout lors de ta première expérience. Comme les effets peuvent varier d'une personne à l'autre, le dosage peut être légèrement augmenté en fonction de tes envies par la suite. Ingrédients Ces mélanges de haschisch combinent les effets agréables des cannabinoïdes avec des herbes 100 % biologiques, riches en terpènes, pour offrir une expérience de fumée ultime. Lorsque tu commandes la COLLECTION DUTCH ORANGE, tu reçois : + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Original + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Intense + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Supreme + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Long Lasting + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Bubblegum + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Blue Dream + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Lemon Haze + 3 grammes de Dutch Orange Strawberry Ice Attention Ce produit n'est pas destiné à la consommation humaine. Évite de les combiner avec d'autres substances qui peuvent avoir un effet néfaste sur ton expérience. Ne pas utiliser avant 18 ans. Si vous êtes enceinte, allaitante ou suivant un traitement médicale, consultez votre médecin. Ne pas dépasser les doses prescrites. La consommation peut affecter l'habilité à conduire ou à utiliser des machines. Ne pas mélanger avec des boissons alcoolisées. Ces substances peuvent provenir de diverses sources telles que les plantes, les herbes et les animaux. Parmi les exemples courants d'aphrodisiaques naturels, citons le ginseng, la racine de maca, les huîtres, le chocolat et le miel. Beaucoup de ces aphrodisiaques sont considérés comme sûrs, mais il est important de noter que leur efficacité peut varier d'une personne à l'autre. Certains peuvent également avoir des effets secondaires potentiels et des interactions avec des médicaments, il est donc important de procéder avec prudence avant d'utiliser tout aphrodisiaque naturel. Deze optie kan gekozen worden op de productpagina Alles bekijken Wij zijn een van de meest gerespecteerde leveranciers op de online markt, en werken hard om dit te onderhouden. Welkom bij TRRCSHOP, de beste bestemming om online Research chemicals te kopen. De beste winkel om je voorraad aan te vullen met geavanceerde materialen voor je experimenten. Wij zijn de winkel om Research chemicals of RC’s te kopen, aan te schaffen, te verkrijgen. Wij verkopen Research chemicals in poeder of kristal maar we hebben ook pellets of blotters. Neem een kijkje bij Alle Producten om te zien wat we aanbieden! Onze producten zijn laboratorium getest en hebben eerlijke prijzen. Over TRRC Shop is een van die weinige online bedrijven, die Kwalitatieve Research chemicals levert voor individuele en/of zakelijke laboratoriumonderzoek en analyse. Wij bieden onze klanten zowel de meest gevraagde als ook zeldzame Research chemicals aan van ten minste 98% zuiverheid. Elke nieuwe partij van het product ondergaat laboratoriumtests en komt bij ons compleet met een certificaat van analyse. Op deze manier weten we altijd dat we onze klanten uitzonderlijk zuivere chemicaliën leveren. Wij leveren hoge kwaliteit veilig aan u TRRC Shop is een geweldige Leverancier van Research chemicals bij het kopen van Research chemicals. Wij garanderen de hoogste kwaliteit voor elk product. We verkopen onze Research chemicals via een vertrouwde webshop. We bewaren onze producten correct, droog op de juiste temperatuur. Producten die wij op voorraad hebben zijn laboratorium getest en testresultaten worden getoond op onze website. Op deze manier zorgen we er altijd voor dat we het juiste product versturen. Wanneer je ervoor kiest om hier je Research chemicals te halen, zorgen wij ervoor dat we zo snel mogelijk verwerken en inpakken. Na ontvangst van betaling gaat uw bestelling in verwerking. We verzamelen alle producten die je hebt besteld en pakken ze in. De eigenschappen of effecten van Research chemicals zijn onbekend en niet ontworpen voor menselijke consumptie. Zorg ervoor dat je op de hoogte bent van eventuele bijwerkingen en informeer naar eventuele veiligheidsrisico's. Wat zijn Research chemicals? Eigenlijk zijn Research chemicals chemisch van aard die voornamelijk door wetenschappers worden gebruikt voor het uitvoeren van verschillende onderzoeken in laboratoria. De chemische stoffen worden alleen voor laboratoriumgebruik gebruikt. Er is een grote behoefte aan. Onthoud voor laboratoriumonderzoek doeleinden alleen en niet te gebruiken voor andere doeleinden. De term Research chemicals wordt door Wikipedia uitgelegd als “chemische stoffen die door wetenschappers worden gebruikt voor medische en wetenschappelijke onderzoeksdoeleinden. Een kenmerk van een onderzoekschemische stof is dat het alleen voor laboratoriumonderzoek is bedoeld; een onderzoekschemische stof is niet bedoeld voor gebruik door mensen of dieren.”
