What Are SARMS? - We Have SARMS For Sale A Selective androgen receptor modulator (SARM) is a type of drug that is designed to selectively bind to androgen receptors in specific tissues, such as muscle and bone. This means that SARMs can have anabolic effects (building muscle) without the same androgenic effects (masculinizing effects) as testosterone. SARMs were first developed in the early 1990s after Dalton and Miller, who discovered that aryl propionamides with structural similarities to bicalutamide and hydroxyflutamide could activate AR-dependent transcriptional activity provided the early lead for the development of diaryl propionamide class of SARMs. However, SARMs are not currently approved for use in humans, and there is a limited amount of research on their safety and efficacy. The potential benefits of SARMs include their anabolic effects without the same androgenic effects as testosterone. This could make them useful for treating conditions such as muscle wasting and osteoporosis. However, the potential risks of SARMs include liver toxicity, cardiovascular disease, and prostate cancer. Different Types of SARMS The majority of SARMs found in the market can typically be encountered in three distinct variations: Powder SARMS: Initially, all SARMs exist as a powdered substance, which is then transformed into either tablet, encased within capsules, or converted into a liquid form. Every SARM initially starts in a powder state. This is the reason many researchers regard powdered SARMs as the most unadulterated version of these medicinal compounds. Powdered SARMs can be effortlessly portioned into the specific quantity needed by the investigator. Gel SARMS: GEL SARMs enjoy considerable popularity as well. They are also referred to as SARMs Capsules.  The enthusiasm primarily stems from the convenience of not needing to measure out capsules, thus making the process more straightforward for researchers. GEL SARMs maintain their initial purity for extended durations. GEL also safeguards the strength of the encapsulated ingredients. This guarantees the uniformity and effectiveness of each individual dose. Active components in liquids have been observed to diminish in potency over time. Liquid SARMS: Liquid SARMs are recognized for their exceptional purity and extended half-life. When appropriately stored, they possess a lengthy shelf life and can be effortlessly measured and preserved. Liquid SARMs hold a distinctive appeal for researchers due to the ease of measuring precise quantities for administration to subjects, with or without water. They demonstrate potential in their respective research fields for those who find it challenging to utilize capsules or pills, particularly when working with animals. Umbrella Labs — Research-Grade Nootropics, Peptides & SARMs (RUO Only) Umbrella Labs is a research chemicals company supplying nootropics, peptides, and SARMs exclusively for laboratory research purposes only. We provide independent purity verification, COAs, and quality control data to support reproducible science. None of our products are intended for human consumption. What is a Certificate of Analysis (COA)? A Certificate of Analysis (COA) is a document produced by an independent or in-house analytical laboratory verifying a compound’s identity, purity, and concentration using methods like HPLC, LC-MS, or NMR. What is High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC)? HPLC is a laboratory technique that separates components in a mixture by passing solvent under high pressure through a column to quantify purity or detect contaminants. What is Liquid Chromatography–Mass Spectrometry (LC-MS)? LC-MS combines liquid chromatography with mass spectrometry to separate, identify, and quantify molecular species by mass-to-charge ratio. What does ≥ 99% purity mean? ≥ 99% purity indicates that 99 percent or more of a sample is the target analyte; impurities (≤1%) are the detectable residual substances. What does “Research Use Only” (RUO) mean? Research Use Only (RUO) means the compound is explicitly for laboratory, analytical, or experimental use—not for medical, diagnostic, or human consumption. Focus on Nootropics – Why They Matter in Research Nootropics (also known as “cognitive enhancers”) are molecules studied for their effects on brain function, memory, focus, and neuroprotection. At Umbrella Labs, we emphasize nootropic compounds—each batch is accompanied by third-party purity data and clear labeling so researchers can compare results with confidence.
